sentences.text: What We Do and What We Dont Do
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation programs are competitive and well-governed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We adopt best practices that make sense for our company and industry and avoid pay practices that are inconsistent with our pay-for-performance structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What we do:  What we dont do:   We use multiple performance measures in our short-term and long-term plans that link compensation to our corporate objectives to be the best operated energy company in North America and to maximize shareholder value   No single-trigger change-in-control payments We make the majority of our compensation for named executive officers at risk to further tie compensation to performance and shareholder interests   No excessive perquisites Our O&C Committee is comprised of all independent directors and our compensation consultant is independent   No tax gross-ups on change-in-control agreements We adopted a clawback mechanism to allow the Company to recover incentive compensation in the event of a material financial restatement   No guaranteed bonuses We require executives and directors to meet robust stock ownership requirements    No pledging, hedging or short sales of Company securities for officers or directors We review and update our peer groups and benchmarking on a regular basis to make sure our compensation remains competitive and near the median of the peer group   No stock option grants since 2010 We engage with shareholders to seek input about our compensation practices and policies   No repricing of existing stock options     No excessive golden parachute payments in any of our change-in-control arrangements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO Total Actual Compensation for 2016: Fixed vs. At-Risk
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our pay mix puts a high weight on performance-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This means that the majority of compensation is variable and will go up or down based on company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, 77% of our Chairman and Chief Executive Officers Compensation was performance-based or at risk.

sentences.text: Overview
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your understanding of our executive compensation program is important to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The goal of this Compensation Discussion and Analysis is to explain:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation philosophy and objectives for executives of the Company, including our Named Executive Officers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The roles of our O&C Committee and management in the executive compensation process;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The key components of the executive compensation program; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The decisions we make in the compensation process that align with our philosophy and objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Throughout this Proxy Statement, the term Named Executive Officers means: (1) the Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer, Gerard M. Anderson; (2) the Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, Peter B. Oleksiak; (3) the Vice Chairman, Steven E. Kurmas; (4) the Vice Chairman and Chief Administrative Officer, David E. Meador; and (5) the President and Chief Operating Officer, Gerardo Norcia.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the term executive includes the Named Executive Officers, other key employees of the Company as designated by management from time to time and Executive Officers as defined by the Exchange Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Philosophy and Objectives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation philosophy is to motivate and reward executives who achieve short-term and long-term corporate and financial objectives leading to the success of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will continue to emphasize performance- based compensation for results that are consistent with shareholder and customer interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The main objectives underlying this philosophy are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation must be competitive in order to attract and retain talented executives  data from peer group companies are taken into consideration when analyzing our compensation practices and levels;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation should have a meaningful performance component  a portion of an executives total compensation opportunity is linked to predefined short-term and long-term corporate and financial objectives along with an executives individual performance; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation must include equity-based elements to encourage executives to have an ownership interest in the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of the Organization and Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has a long-standing process for determining executive compensation that is performance-based, objective, and transparent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The process is designed to serve the purpose of recruiting, retaining and motivating executives for the benefit of shareholders and customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board delegates to the O&C Committee the responsibility to determine and approve the CEOs compensation, and to approve the compensation of certain other executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The O&C Committee makes all decisions regarding compensation for the Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the responsibilities have been delegated, the entire Board maintains oversight and receives direct reports after each O&C Committee meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The O&C Committee is composed entirely of independent directors, none of whom derives a personal benefit from the compensation decisions the O&C Committee makes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, the O&C Committee is responsible for our executive compensation programs throughout the enterprise (including subsidiaries).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The O&C Committee responsibilities are more fully detailed in its charter, which is available at dteenergy.com/governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The O&C Committee continually monitors the executive compensation program and adopts changes to reflect the dynamic marketplace in which we compete for talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent necessary, the O&C Committee also works with other Board committees to review or approve reports, awards and other matters relating to compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, the Finance Committee reviews the financial components of performance measures and metrics, the Corporate Governance Committee assists in the review of this Compensation Discussion and Analysis and the Audit Committee reviews the internal controls over the data reported herein.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The O&C Committee uses information from several external sources to monitor and achieve an executive compensation program that supports our business goals and attracts executives whose performance will be measured against those goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Executive Performance Plan, the O&C Committee will annually allocate a percentage of the overall maximum award pool established under that plan to each Applicable Officer as defined on page 42 and retains the discretion to reduce the maximum award payable to any individual Applicable Officer based on the results of the performance goals established by the O&C Committee for that officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent outside consultants and external information enable the O&C Committee to maintain impartial decision- making regarding performance and pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The O&C Committee annually reviews each component of the Named Executive Officers compensation and is advised directly by the outside compensation consulting firm, discussed in further detail below, in connection with such review.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on input from its consultant and from management and based on a review of competitive data from peer group companies (as discussed below), the O&C Committee believes that the current structure is appropriately balanced and competitive to accomplish the important tasks of recruiting, retaining, and motivating talented executives in the energy industry in which we compete.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The O&C Committee also reviews and considers the results from the most recent shareholder advisory vote on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the 2015 and 2016 annual meetings, 87.3% and 96.2%, respectively, of voting shareholders approved the compensation of the Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of our shareholder engagement program, we seek feedback from shareholders about our compensation practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent Review of Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The O&C Committee directly employs an outside consulting firm, Mercer Human Resources Consulting LLC (Mercer HR), a subsidiary of Marsh & McClennan Companies, Inc., to advise the O&C Committee on various executive compensation matters, including current compensation trends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mercer HR also provides objective recommendations as to the design of our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mercer HR reports directly to the O&C Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Use of this outside consultant is an important component of the compensation setting process, as it enables the O&C Committee to make informed decisions based on market data and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The representative from Mercer HR, who is considered a leading professional in the compensation field, attends O&C Committee meetings, meets with Committee members in executive session, consults with the members as required and provides input with regard to the CEOs compensation and performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mercer HR has served as the O&C Committees outside consultant since 2002.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The O&C Committee has determined Mercer HR to be an independent consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mercer HR has no affiliations with any of the Named Executive Officers or members of the Board other than in its role as an outside consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The lead consultant and partner in charge for Mercer HR, who provides executive compensation consulting services to the O&C Committee, does not provide any other services to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To help ensure that the consultant maintains the highest level of independence from the Company, all work performed by Mercer HR and its affiliates
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) which falls outside the scope of work performed for the O&C Committee on executive compensation matters, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) which has a total cost of $750,000 or greater, requires pre- approval by the O&C Committee based upon the recommendation of management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we paid Mercer HR $128,001.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in 2016 the Company paid $25,000 for services unrelated to human resources consulting to affiliates of Mercer HR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the O&C Committee followed its process to pre-approve certain work awarded to affiliates of Mercer HR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Managements Role
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our management works closely with the O&C Committee in the executive compensation process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Excluding the CEOs compensation, managements responsibilities include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommending performance measures and metrics that are formulated based on our corporate strategy and priorities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reporting executive performance evaluations;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommending base salary levels and other compensation, including equity awards; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommending appointment of executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEOs compensation is determined solely by the O&C Committee, which bases its decisions on performance and market studies along with participation and recommendations from its independent outside consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation and Peer Group Assessment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each component of executive compensation (see Key Components of Executive Compensation below) is compared, measured and evaluated against a peer group of companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The O&C Committee approves the peer group and periodically reviews and updates the companies included in that group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management also retains an external consulting firm to conduct a market study covering compensation practices for similar positions in the peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The most recent market study was completed in December 2016 by Aon Hewitt, whose comprehensive database included all of our desired utility/energy peer companies and also included data for most of our utility/energy-related executive positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The most recent peer group study was approved by the O&C Committee in June 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: That peer group study, which is applicable for 2016, consisted of the companies listed below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Most of these companies, along with DTE Energy, participate in the same independent compensation surveys.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The surveys provide data needed for accurate compensation comparisons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The peer group consists primarily of utilities (including utility holding companies), broad-based energy companies, and significant non-energy companies selected on the basis of revenues, financial strength, geographic location and availability of compensation information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The O&C Committee reviews the peer group data when making compensation decisions relating to the Named Executive Officers and the Companys mix of compensation components.

sentences.text: Key Components of Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The key components of the compensation program include the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual and Long-Term Incentives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pension and Deferred Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Post-Termination Agreements (Severance and Change-In-Control)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the programs and pay levels reflect differences in job responsibilities, the structure of the compensation and benefits program is applied consistently to our Named Executive Officers, including the CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Differences in compensation between the CEO and the other Named Executive Officers are due, in part, to an analysis of peer group benchmark data, as well as differences in the responsibilities of each Named Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We review each element of total compensation, both individually and on a combined basis, for each Named Executive Officer and make adjustments as appropriate based on these comparisons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following is a more detailed discussion of the components of the Companys executive compensation program:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The objective of base salary is to provide a stable, fixed source of income that reflects an executives job responsibilities, experience, value to the Company, and demonstrated performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When setting individual base salary levels, we consider several factors, including
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the market reference point for the executives position,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the responsibilities of the executives position,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the experience and performance of the executive, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) retention issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Market reference points target the median for most positions, adjusted to take into account differences in company size within the peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we establish midpoints for each executive group level for determining base salary for those executives whose jobs cannot be easily matched in the marketplace.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These midpoints are consistent with the market reference points for other executives in the same executive group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We review these midpoints annually to ensure they are consistent with the market and make salary adjustments, when appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual and Long-Term Incentives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have two primary types of incentives that reward executives for performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The incentives are designed to tie compensation to performance and encourage executives to align their interests with those of the shareholders and customers of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our annual incentives allow us to reward executives with annual cash bonuses for performance against pre-established objectives based on work performed in the prior year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our long-term incentives allow us to grant executives long-term equity incentives to encourage continued employment with DTE Energy, to accomplish pre-defined long-term performance objectives and to create shareholder alignment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the current mix among base salary, the annual incentives and the long-term incentives is appropriately set to provide market-competitive compensation when Company performance warrants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The mix is more heavily weighted toward incentive compensation at higher executive levels within DTE Energy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The interplay between the annual incentives and the long-term incentives provides a balance to motivate executives to achieve our business goals and objectives and to properly reward executives for the achievement of such goals and objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has implemented a clawback policy that provides that, in the event of an accounting restatement due to material noncompliance with federal securities laws and based on a determination of the O&C Committee, the Company may recover any excess performance-based compensation awarded as a result of the restatement from any of our current or former officers who received performance-based compensation (including awards under the Annual Incentive Plan, the Long-Term Incentive Plan and the Executive Performance Plan) during the three-year period preceding the date on which the Company is required to prepare an accounting restatement, in accordance with applicable law and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Performance Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders approved the material terms of the DTE Energy Executive Performance Plan (Executive Performance Plan) at the 2015 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Performance Plan is the Companys umbrella plan designed to satisfy the requirements of Internal Revenue Code Section 162(m) and to serve as the funding vehicle for all of the annual and certain long-term incentive compensation paid to the designated executive officers selected to participate in the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2016 plan year, all annual incentive awards and the vested restricted stock awards for the Named Executive Officers were paid under the Executive Performance Plan in early 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Formula  Maximum Fund Amount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Performance Plan includes a performance formula that was approved by shareholders and will not be changed without shareholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys performance for each plan year is then used to calculate the maximum potential award fund for all awards under the Executive Performance Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum fund amount for all awards for any plan year under the Executive Performance Plan will be three percent of DTE Energy Company Adjusted Net Income for that year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DTE Energy Adjusted Net Income is DTE Energy Net Income adjusted to subtract Net Income for the Energy Trading reporting segment for that year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DTE Energy Net Income is defined as the Companys profit as reported on the Companys Consolidated Statements of Operations under the heading Net Income Attributable to DTE Energy Company in the Companys audited financial statements as filed with the SEC in the Companys Form 10-K for the relevant year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net Income for the Energy Trading reporting segment is reported in the Energy Trading subsection of the Managements Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations section as disclosed in the Companys Form 10-K for the relevant year, based on information reported in the Companys audited financial statements as filed with the Companys Form 10-K.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Applicable Officers and Allocations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Not later than the ninetieth day of each calendar year, the O&C Committee will determine
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) which executive officers will participate in the Executive Performance Plan for that calendar year (the Applicable Officers) and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the individual maximum award allocated to each Applicable Officer as a percentage of the maximum award fund.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of the Executive Performance Plan, no single Applicable Officer may be allocated or receive an award of more than the lesser of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) fifty percent of the maximum award fund or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) ten million dollars ($10,000,000).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After the end of a calendar year, when the Companys final Adjusted Net Income result for that year is available, the O&C Committee will determine the maximum individual award amount for each Applicable Officer based on those allocation percentages.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The O&C Committee has the ability to apply negative discretion to adjust the final awards down (but never up) from that maximum individual amount based on the results of performance goals approved by the O&C Committee for that Applicable Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The O&C Committee applied each Applicable Officers 2016 individual performance goals originally set using the Annual Incentive Plan measures, metrics, targets and procedures when determining the amount of the Applicable Officers 2016 award under the Executive Performance Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is the intention of the O&C Committee that the total annual incentive award for each Applicable Officer paid under the Executive Performance Plan for any year will not exceed the amount that would have been awarded to the Applicable Officer for that year if the Applicable Officers award had been made under the Annual Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the Named Executive Officers were Applicable Officers under the Executive Performance Plan for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table sets forth each Named Executive Officers allocation percentage of the maximum award fund (Maximum Award Percentage) for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 maximum individual award amount is calculated by multiplying the Maximum Award Percentage by 3 percent of DTE Energy Adjusted Net Income (Maximum Individual Amount).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The final total 2016 executive performance plan award is the result of the O&C Committee exercising its negative discretion to reduce the Maximum Individual Amount (Actual Award Amount).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Actual Award Amount does not include the value of dividends paid on unvested restricted stock paid under the Executive Performance Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Incentives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The objective of the annual incentives is to compensate individuals yearly based on the achievement of specific annual goals and tie compensation to near-term performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have two main plans for paying annual incentive awards to our executives: the DTE Energy Annual Incentive Plan (Annual Incentive Plan) and the Executive Performance Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning with 2015, the annual incentive awards for the Named Executive Officers are paid under the Executive Performance Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The O&C Committee sets individual performance measures, metrics and targets for the Named Executive Officers for each year using the Annual Incentive Plan measure, metrics, targets and procedures described below, and the Named Executive Officers performance against those measures, metrics and targets is considered when the O&C Committee determines the officers annual incentive award under the Executive Performance Plan for that year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of the Annual Incentive Plan, participating executives and other select employees may receive annual cash awards based on performance compared against pre-established Company and business unit objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Objectives that management proposes are reviewed and approved or revised by the O&C Committee, with financial goal recommendations reviewed by the Boards Finance Committee, no later than 90 days after the beginning of the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The objectives include performance measures in several categories that are critical to our success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When setting these objectives, management and the O&C Committee determine the elements of our business that require the focused attention of the executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The weights, which can change from year-to-year, are determined based on the Companys key priorities and areas of focus for the upcoming year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The final awards, if any, are paid after the O&C Committee approves the final results of each objective.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of an executives Annual Incentive Plan award is determined as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executives most recent year-end base salary is multiplied by an Annual Incentive Plan target percentage to arrive at the target award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The overall performance payout percentage, which can range from 0% to 175%, is determined based on final result compared to threshold, target, and maximum levels for each objective.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target award is then multiplied by the performance payout percentage to arrive at the pre-adjusted calculated award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The pre-adjusted calculated award is then adjusted by an individual performance modifier (assessment of an individual executives achievements for the year), which can range from 0% to 150%, to arrive at the final award
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each objective has a threshold, target and maximum level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company or relevant business unit must attain a minimum level of achievement for an objective before any compensation is payable with respect to that objective.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The minimum
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: established level of each objective will result in a payout of 25% of target and the maximum established for each level (or better) will result in a payment of up to 175% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) electric generation and distribution reliability and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) gas system reliability, gas system availability, and the pace of gas system improvements.

sentences.text: The measures in the above table are defined below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DTE Energy Operating Earnings Per Share: DTE Energy reported earnings after operating adjustments (exclusion of non- recurring items, certain mark-to-market adjustments and discontinued operations) divided by average shares outstanding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DTE Energy Adjusted Cash Flow: DTE Energy net cash from operating activities adjusted by utility capital expenditures, asset sale proceeds and other items approved by the O&C Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Customer Satisfaction Index: Measures the satisfaction of four customer segments: (1) electric residential, (2) gas residential, (3) electric business, and (4) gas business using industry standard methodology developed by JD Power Associates (JDPA) to determine performance percentile relative to peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Customer Satisfaction Improvement Program Index: The calculation for defects per million opportunities (DPMO) which will include defects from DTE Cares callbacks, self-service transactions and new transactions based on the actual proportions of customer interactions measured as a reduction from the 2015 weighted baseline.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MPSC Customer Complaints: Number of complaints received by the Michigan Public Service Commission (MPSC) in th calendar year for all business units across DTE Energy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DTE Energy Employee EngagementGallup: The average of the DTE Energy Company Gallup Grand Mean scores from two surveys during the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Safety Performance and Effectiveness Index: Includes two measures that are a representation of safety performance:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. DTE Energy OSHA Recordable Incident Rate: Number of Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) defined recordable injuries in the calendar year per 100 employees (working an average of 2,000 hours per year, per employee) divided by the actual number of hours worked.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. DTE Energy OSHA Days Away, Restricted and Transfers Rate: The number of OSHA defined recordable injuries that resulted in days away from work, work restrictions, and/or job duty/position transfer due to work- related injuries (DART) in the calendar year per 100 employees (working an average of 2,000 hours per year, per employee) divided by the actual number of hours worked by business unit measured.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Utility Operating Excellence Index: Corporate index that encompasses eleven operating excellence measures:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. CEMI4 Customers: Customers experiencing multiple interruptions greater than or equal to four, expressed as a percent of total customers served.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. All Weather SAIDI (System Average Interruption Duration Index): All customers experiencing an outage, the average minutes of interruption, regardless of weather conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. Blue Sky CAIDI (Customer Average Interruption Duration Index): A subset of All Weather CAIDI for those days where there is no declared storm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A storm is declared when there are 15,000 outages in 24 hours.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. Fossil Power Plant Reliability: The Monroe and Belle River Random Outage Factor (ROF) which is the weighted average of the six base load coal units year-end ROF.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A units ROF is the percentage of time that a unit is not capable of reaching 100% capacity, excluding planned outages.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. Annual Collective Radiation Exposure: The total annual external and internal whole body exposure for station personnel, supplemental personnel and those personnel visiting the site or station on official utility business measured in Roentgen Equivalent Man (REM).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6. Nuclear Power Plant Reliability: The ratio of the available energy generation over a given time period to the reference generation over the same time period, expressed as a percentage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Available energy generation is the energy that could have been produced under reference ambient conditions considering only limitations within control of plant management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reference energy generation is the energy that could be produced if the unit were operated continuously at full power under reference ambient conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7. Maintenance Performance: A score from 0 to 18  measuring outcomes across 9 maintenance performance metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 8. Operational Focus Performance: A score from 0 to 22 measuring outcomes across 11 operational performance metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 9. Gas Distribution System Improvement: The number of open leaks in the system as of December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 10. Distribution Leak Response Time: Elapsed time in minutes from when the customer reports the condition to when the Field Services employee arrives at the site.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 11. Lost and Unaccounted for Gas: Lost and unaccounted for gas from the source and disposition report measured in billion cubic feet (Bcf).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is a function of multiple contributors including transmission losses, theft, leaks, billing inaccuracies and metering equipment condition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 12. Compression Reliability: The total number of available hours less the number of hours unavailable due to planned and unplanned shutdowns, divided by the total hours in one year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 13. Damage Prevention Effectiveness: Number of third party damages to main and service gas lines per 1,000 tickets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A ticket is defined as one staking request received from 811 (Miss Dig).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 14. Transmission Reliability: Installation of remote control valves (RCV) on the gas transmission system in the areas defined by regulation as High Consequence Areas (HCA).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HCA is established largely by population density.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The metric is measured as RCV unit installation completed, including commissioning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate weighted payment percentage for the pre-adjusted calculated award was 127.63% for all of the Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The pre-adjusted awards are adjusted by an individual performance modifier for each of the Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individual performance criteria are set at the beginning of each calendar year for each of the Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, qualitative criteria include, as applicable, leadership performance, overall operational performance, employee engagement and customer performance, diversity, continuous operational improvements and other appropriate operating measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The O&C Committee evaluates the individual performance of each of the Named Executive Officers and approves an adjustment to the annual award based on the individual contribution and performance.

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term incentives provide the O&C Committee the ability to design programs that focus on our long-term performance over a three-year period, with the objective to align executives interests with those of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our principles for ownership of stock, discussed on page 51, ensure that the executives and other employees have a vested interest in the long-term financial health, management, and success of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The long-term incentives reward executives and other employees with stock-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These incentives are generally awarded under the Long-Term Incentive Plan; however, certain long-term incentives are awarded under the Executive Performance Plan, with any equity awards made under the Executive Performance Plan subject to the terms of the Long-Term Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Named Executive Officers are eligible to receive restricted stock, performance shares, performance units, stock options or a combination of these awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since the creation of the Long-Term Incentive Plan, we have granted only performance shares, time-based restricted stock and nonqualified stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the O&C Committee has not granted stock options under the Long-Term Incentive Plan since 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives receive long-term incentive grants based upon a target percentage of base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The targeted award levels for the Named Executive Officers for 2016 were as follows: Mr. Anderson, 375% of base salary; Mr. Oleksiak, 185% of base salary; Mr. Kurmas, 225% of base salary; Mr. Meador, 200% of base salary; and Mr. Norcia, 215% of base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the targeted award levels, the O&C Committee also considers previous years grants, career potential, and retention issues in determining the final number of awards granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value of each element of these long-term incentive grants for 2016 was as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Shares   Approximately 70% Restricted Stock   Approximately 30%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This mix was designed to provide a balance of incentives to executives for creating long-term shareholder value through strong financial and operating performance and to align executive interests with shareholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Shares Granted in 2016:     In 2016, performance shares represented approximately 70% of the overall long-term incentive grant value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Granting of performance shares allows us to tie long-term performance objectives with creating shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance shares entitle the executive to receive a specified number of shares, or a cash payment equal to the fair market value of the shares, or a combination of the two, in the plan administrators discretion, depending on the level of achievement of performance measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance measurement period for the 2016 grants is January 1, 2016 through December 31, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payments earned under the 2016 grants and the related performance measures are described in footnote 2 to the Grants of Plan-Based Awards table on page 55.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event a participant retires (age 55 or older with at least 10 years of service), dies or becomes disabled, the participant or beneficiary retains the right to a pro-rated number of the performance shares that would otherwise have been payable based upon actual results for the entire performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event employment terminates for any other reason, the participant forfeits all rights to any outstanding performance shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In June 2009, the O&C Committee decided that, beginning with the 2010 performance share grants, dividends or dividend equivalents would not be paid on unvested or unearned performance shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the period beginning on the date the performance shares are awarded and ending on the certification date of the performance objectives, the number of performance shares awarded will be increased, assuming full dividend reinvestment at the fair market value on the dividend payment date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The cumulative number of performance shares will be adjusted to determine the final payment based on the performance objectives as certified by the committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock:    The restricted stock we grant is time-based restricted stock and generally includes a three-year vesting period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The granting of restricted stock allows us to grant executives long-term equity incentives to encourage continued employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, restricted stock was granted, representing approximately 30% of the overall Long-Term Incentive Plan grant value, with the restriction period ending on February 3, 2019.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The three-year vesting period focuses on long-term value creation and executive retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The three-year vesting period requires continued employment throughout the restriction period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted stock grants generally do not qualify as performance-based compensation under Internal Revenue Code Section 162(m) and are included when computing the allowable deduction for compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, for performance periods following shareholder approval of the Executive Performance Plan at the 2015 Annual Meeting, the full value of restricted stock grants will be treated as part of each officers annual award under the Executive Performance Plan for the year in which vesting occurs, to the extent that full value, when combined with other incentive payments to the officer, does not exceed the lesser of the officers Maximum Individual Amount under the Executive Performance Plan for that year or $10 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information, see Internal Revenue Code Limits on Deductibility of Compensation on page 51.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event a participant retires (age 55 or older with at least 10 years of service), dies or becomes disabled, the participant or beneficiary retains the right to a pro-rated number of restricted shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event the employment terminates for any other reason, the participant forfeits all rights to any outstanding restricted shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Options:    The O&C Committee has not granted stock options under the Long-Term Incentive Plan since 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2010, nonqualified stock options represented approximately 20% of the overall Long-Term Incentive Plan grant value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The granting of stock options allowed us to grant executives long-term equity incentives that align long- term performance with creating shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These stock options have a ten-year exercise period and vest one-third on each anniversary of the grant date over a three-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The stock option exercise price is based on the closing price on the date the options are granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event a participant retires (age 55 or older with at least 10 years of service) or becomes disabled, the participant retains the rights to all outstanding vested and unvested stock options in accordance with the original terms of the grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event a participant dies, the beneficiary has three years from the date of death to exercise the stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event employment terminates for any other reason, the participant forfeits all rights to any unvested stock options and has 90 days to exercise any vested stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2014, the Board adopted an amendment to the Long-Term Incentive Plan that prohibits the cash buyout of underwater stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This policy applied to all previously issued stock options and to options issued in the future, if any.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pension and Deferred Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pension Benefits Substantially all non-represented employees, including our Named Executive Officers, are eligible to participate in our tax-qualified pension plan (if hired prior to 2012), the DTE Energy Company Retirement Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Named Executive Officers are also eligible to participate in our nonqualified pension plans, the DTE Energy Company Supplemental Retirement Plan and the DTE Energy Company Executive Supplemental Retirement Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred Compensation Substantially all employees, including our Named Executive Officers, are eligible to participate in one of our tax-qualified 401(k) plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Named Executives Officers participate in the DTE Energy Company Savings and Stock Ownership Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Named Executive Officers are also eligible to participate in our nonqualified 401(k) plan, the DTE Energy Company Supplemental Savings Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company also sponsors the DTE Energy Company Executive Deferred Compensation Plan, a nonqualified deferred compensation plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, this plan was closed effective as of January 1, 2007 for future deferrals and none of the Named Executive Officers participate in the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Providing supplemental pension and deferred compensation benefits for our executives is in keeping with our philosophy and objectives to attract and retain talented executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Pension Benefits Table and related footnotes beginning on page 58 describe both the tax-qualified and nonqualified pension benefits for which certain executives are eligible and which are commonly offered by other employers in our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For further description of the nonqualified supplemental pension and deferred compensation benefits, see Pension Benefits beginning on page 57.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide executives with certain benefits generally not available to our other employees as a matter of competitive practice and as a retention tool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The O&C Committee periodically reviews the level of benefits provided to executives against a peer group to ensure they are reasonable and consistent with our overall compensation objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide a cash allowance to certain executives in lieu of executive benefits typically provided by other companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive is permitted to use the allowance as he or she deems appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the allowance is taxable for income ax purposes, it is not considered as compensation for any Company incentive or benefit program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, we provided various benefits for a limited number of officers that included the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Security driver for business: Based on our executive security policies and a security risk assessment by the Companys chief security officer, the Board requires Mr. Anderson to use a Company car and security driver while on Company business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate aircraft for limited business travel: We lease a fractional share of an aircraft for limited business travel by executives and other employees when there is an appropriate business purpose.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Personal use of the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: aircraft is not allowed except in unusual circumstances and requires the prior approval of the CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, there was no personal use of the corporate aircraft.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other benefits: Executives are allowed the limited use of corporate event tickets and the corporate condominium when available.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company also provides home security monitoring for some executives, including some of the Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Post-Termination Agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have entered into indemnification agreements and change-in-control agreements with each of the Named Executive Officers and certain other executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The indemnification agreements require that we indemnify these individuals for certain liabilities to which they may become subject as a result of their affiliation with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The change-in-contro agreements are intended to provide continuity of management in the event there is a change in control of the Company and to align executive and shareholder interests in support of corporate transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The important terms of, and the potential payments provided under, the change-in-control agreements are described beginning on page 62.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our principles for ownership of stock ensure that the executives and other employees have a vested interest in the financial health, management and success of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect most executives and certain other employees to own, within five years of their appointment to such position, shares of our stock having a value equal to a multiple of their annual base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Common stock, time-based restricted stock, phantom stock, and unvested performance shares (assuming achievement of target levels of performance) are counted toward the fulfillment of this ownership requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following are the requirements for the Named Executive Officers:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) for Mr. Anderson, five times his base salary;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) for Messrs. Kurmas, Meador and Norcia, four times their respective base salary; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) for Mr. Oleksiak, three times his base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other executives and employees may be required to hold from one to three times their base salaries as determined by their executive group level within the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, 100% of the Named Executive Officers and all of the other required employees who have served in their position for at least five years have met the stock ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Internal Revenue Code Limits on Deductibility of Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In evaluating the potential compensation alternatives, our O&C Committee considers the possible impact of Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, which places a limit of $1 million on the amount of compensation we can deduct as a business expense on our federal income tax return with respect to covered employees unless it is
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) based on performance and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) paid under a program that meets Internal Revenue Code requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, covered employees for these purposes are our CEO and the three highest paid executive officers named in the Summary Compensation Table on page 53 other than the CEO and CFO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent practicable and consistent with the objectives and underlying philosophy of our executive compensation program, the O&C Committee generally intends most components of executive compensation to qualify as tax deductible for federal income tax purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Performance Plan is designed to enable the Company to pay awards that qualify as performance-based compensation under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As required pursuant to Section 162(m), shareholders approved the material terms of the Executive Performance Plan at the 2015 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For years in which vesting of restricted stock grants occurs, the value of such restricted stock will be part of the paid awards included in the Named Executive Officers allocation of the maximum award fund established by the objective performance factor under the Executive Performance Plan, so that the total amounts paid to the Named Executive Officer under the Executive Performance Plan will satisfy the requirements for tax deductibility by the Company under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the O&C Committee retains the discretion to reduce the payout under the Executive Performance Plan of restricted stock, or any other award, to a Named Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We intend to continue to utilize shareholder-approved plans and performance-based awards to allow the Company to deduct most annual and long-term incentive compensation paid to Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the O&C Committee may exercise discretion to pay nondeductible compensation if following the requirements of Section  162(m) would not be in the interests of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2016 tax year, the Company paid the Named Executive Officers a
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: total of $0.4 million which was not deductible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have also structured all of our nonqualified compensation programs to be in compliance with Internal Revenue Code Section 409A, as added by the American Jobs Creation Act of 2004.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Internal Revenue Code Section 409A imposes additional tax penalties on our executive officers for certain types of deferred compensation that are not in compliance with the form and timing of elections and distribution requirements of that section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accounting considerations also play a role in our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Financial Accounting Standards Board Accounting Standards Codification Topic 718 (ASC Topic 718) requires us to expense the fair value of our stock option grants over the vesting period, which reduces the amount of our reported profits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because of this stock-based expensing and the impact of dilution to our shareholders, we closely monitor the number and the fair values of the option shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on that review and discussion, we recommended to the Board that the Compensation Discussion and Analysis be included in the Companys 2017 Proxy Statement.

sentences.text: Pension Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of the following discussion concerning the tax-qualified and nonqualified pension benefits for which our Named Executive Officers are eligible, we will be using the following terms:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash Balance Plan means the New Horizon Cash Balance component of the Retirement Plan (tax-qualified plan)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MCN Retirement Plan means the MCN Traditional component of the Retirement Plan (tax-qualified plan)  MSBP means the Management Supplemental Benefit Plan (nonqualified plan for tax purposes), a component of the ESRP
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement Plan means the DTE Energy Company Retirement Plan (tax-qualified plan)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SRP means the DTE Energy Company Supplemental Retirement Plan (nonqualified plan for tax purposes)  Traditional Retirement Plan means the DTE Traditional component of the Retirement Plan (tax-qualified plan)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Pension Benefits table below describes the tax-qualified and nonqualified pension benefits for the Named Executive Officers as of December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Name   Plan Name (1)   Number of Years Credited Service (#)       Present Value of Accumulated Benefit ($) Gerard M. Anderson  Retirement Plan   23.1        1,258,775    SRP   23.1        4,790,465    ESRP   23.1        6,575,839 Peter B. Oleksiak  Retirement Plan   18.7        350,576    SRP   18.7        296,135    ESRP   18.7        1,643,533 Steven E. Kurmas  Retirement Plan   37.3        2,542,402    SRP   37.3        3,368,538    ESRP   37.3        2,060,668 David E. Meador  Retirement Plan   19.8        1,129,150    SRP   19.8        1,728,810    ESRP   29.8   (2)   4,936,981 Gerardo Norcia  Retirement Plan   14.2        201,246    SRP   14.2        493,723    ESRP   14.2        1,393,069
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) As described below, Messrs. Anderson, Oleksiak and Meador each have a choice between the MSBP and DC ESRP benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ESRP number that is reported is the higher of the MSBP or DC ESRP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) For purposes of calculating the benefit under the MSBP only, Mr. Meador has 10 years of additional awarded service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Meadors eligibility for the additional awarded service, granted at the time of hire, is subject to his meeting the eligibility requirements of the MSBP, which he has met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This additional time was granted to Mr. Meador as compensation for his unearned pension benefits from his previous employer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If additional service is awarded, the MSBP benefit is reduced by any benefit from the noncontributory portion of a prior employers retirement plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Retirement Plan is closed to non-represented employees hired after December 31, 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Retirement Plan includes a number of different benefit accrual formulas including the Traditional Retirement Plan, the MCN Retirement Plan and the Cash Balance Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Messrs. Anderson and Meador participate in the Traditional Retirement Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Kurmas participates in the MCN Retirement Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Messrs. Oleksiak and Norcia participate in the Cash Balance Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Named Executive Officers are currently 100% vested in the Retirement Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Traditional Retirement Plan:     The benefits provided under the Traditional Retirement Plan are based on an employees years of benefit service, average final compensation and age at termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation used to calculate the benefits under the Traditional Retirement Plan consists of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) base salary and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) lump sums in lieu of base salary increases for the highest five consecutive calendar years within the last 10 years prior to termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The monthly benefit at age 65 equals 1.5% for each year of credited service times the average final compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Early pension benefits are immediately available to any employee who has at least 15 years of service and has attained age 45.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefit can be paid in in one of various annuity options or in an immediate 100% lump sum payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Messrs. Anderson and Meador are currently eligible for early pension benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MCN Retirement Plan:     The benefits provided under this plan are based on an employees years of benefit service, average final compensation and age at termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation used to calculate the benefits under the MCN Retirement Plan consists of base salary for the highest five consecutive calendar years within the last 10 years prior to termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The monthly benefit at age 65 consists of the total of the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1.33% for each year of credited service up to 30, times average final compensation, plus,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1.43% for each year of credited service over 30, times average final compensation, plus,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 0.5% for each year of credited service up to 35, times average final compensation minus covered compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An employee who has attained age 55 and whose combined attained age and years of credit service equals at least 70, or who has 30 or more years of credited service regardless of age, is eligible for an early pension benefit starting before the participants normal retirement age.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefit can be paid in one of various annuity options, a combination of an annuity option and a partial lump sum, or in an immediate 100% lump sum payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Kurmas is currently eligible for an early pension.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash Balance Plan:    The benefits provided under the Cash Balance Plan are expressed as a lump sum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The cash balance benefit increases each year with contribution credits and interest credits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Contribution credits equal 7% of eligible earnings (base salary and annual corporate incentive payments from the Annual Incentive Plan and the Executive Performance Plan) for an employee with 30 years or less of credited service and 7 1/2% of eligible earnings for an employee with more than 30 years of credited service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Interest credits are based on the average 30-year Treasury rates for the month of September prior to the plan year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Interest on each years January 1 benefit is added the following December 31.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The interest credit does not apply to the contribution for the current year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon termination of employment, a vested employee may, at any time, elect to receive the value of his benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an employee elects to defer the benefit, interest credits will continue to accrue on the deferred benefit until the distribution of the benefit begins.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An employee may elect to receive the benefit as a lump sum payout or as a monthly annuity, but not both.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an employee elects the lump-sum option, the entire lump sum is eligible to be rolled over to another qualified plan or IRA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Messrs. Oleksiak and Norcia are currently eligible for the full value of their plan benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nonqualified Retirement Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SRP:     The benefits provided under the SRP are those benefits that would otherwise have been paid under the Retirement Plan but for the limitations imposed on qualified plans by the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefits under
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the SRP are payable in equal monthly installments for life or in annual installments from two to fifteen years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ESRP:     The ESRP includes two components, the MSBP and the DC ESRP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the current terms of the ESRP, certain participants, including Messrs. Anderson, Oleksiak and Meador, will receive a choice at termination of employment of either the MSBP or DC ESRP benefit, but not both.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Messrs. Kurmas and Norcia are only eligible to participate in the DC ESRP component of the ESRP and not the MSBP component.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MSBP:     Prior to January 1, 2001, many Company executives, including Messrs. Anderson, Oleksiak and Meador, participated in the MSBP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MSBP was incorporated into the ESRP as of January 1, 2001.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MSBP requires an executive to be at least age 55 with 10 years of service to receive benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both Mr. Anderson and Mr. Meador are currently eligible for MSBP benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefits provided under the MSBP set a target retirement benefit and are basically equal to 60% of average final compensation for the Named Executive Officers (other than Messrs. Kurmas and Norcia, who are not covered under the MSBP component of the ESRP).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This amount is then adjusted based on age at termination, years of service (actual service and awarded service), and payment option selected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The adjusted amount is offset by the amount that is paid from the Retirement Plan, SRP and any benefit from the noncontributory portion of a prior employers pension plan (if awarded service has been granted).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation used to calculate the benefits under the MSBP includes the highest 260 weeks of base salary, lump sums in lieu of base salary increases and, for years prior to 2001, the annual incentive bonus paid under the Shareholder Value Improvement Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subsequent to 2000, when the Shareholder Value Improvement Plan was eliminated, the highest 260 weeks includes 10% of an executives base salary in lieu of a bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefits under the MSBP are payable in equal monthly installments for life.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of a change in control of the Company, executives who have entered into Change-In-Control Severance Agreements with the Company would receive an additional two years of age and service credits for purposes of the MSBP or any successor plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Potential Payments Upon Termination of Employment beginning on page 62 for further explanation of the change-in-control provision of the MSBP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DC ESRP:     Effective January 1, 2001, we implemented the DC ESRP, a defined-contribution approach to nonqualified supplemental pension benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The DC ESRP approach was effective for most of the newly hired or promoted executives after that date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The DC ESRP provides for a benefit equal to a stated percentage of base salary and annual corporate incentive payments from the Annual Incentive Plan and the Executive Performance Plan that is credited to a bookkeeping account on behalf of eligible executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the Named Executive Officers, the contribution percentage is 10%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The account value will increase or decrease based on the performance of the investment elections under the plan, as directed by the participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vesting of the benefit under the DC ESRP occurs at a rate of 20% per anniversary year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the Named Executive Officers are 100% vested in their DC ESRP accounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefits under the DC ESRP are payable in a lump sum or annual installments from two to fifteen years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of a change-in-control of the Company, executives who have entered into Change-In- Control Severance Agreements with the Company would receive an additional two years of compensation credits fo purposes of the DC ESRP or any successor plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Potential Payments Upon Termination of Employment beginning on page 62 for further explanation of the change-in-control provision of the DC ESRP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of the following discussion concerning the tax-qualified and nonqualified deferred compensation for which our Named Executive Officers are eligible, we will be using the following terms:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: "Savings Plan" means the DTE Energy Company Savings and Stock Ownership Plan (tax-qualified 401(k) plan)  "Supplemental Savings Plan" means the DTE Energy Company Supplemental Savings Plan (nonqualified 401(k) plan)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax-Qualified Deferred Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Named Executive Officers participate in the Savings Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant may contribute up to 100% (less applicable FICA taxes and other legally required or voluntary deductions) of eligible compensation to the Savings Plan as pre-tax, Roth, after-tax and, if applicable, a catch-up contribution basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants are 100% vested at all times in the value of their contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the DTE Electric portion of the Savings Plan (including all of the Named Executive Officers other than Mr. Kurmas), we contribute $1 to the participants Savings Plan account for each $1 the participant contributes on the first 4% of eligible compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We contribute $0.50 for each $1 contributed on the next 4% of eligible compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the MCN portion of the Savings Plan, for Mr. Kurmas, we make matching contributions $1 for $1 on the first 6% of eligible compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the Named Executive Officers are vested in their Company matching contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For participants hired beginning in 2012 (2013 for non-regulated affiliate companies), the Company automatically contributes an amount, in addition to the DTE Electric matching contributions described above, that is equal to 4% of eligible compensation (additional employer contributions).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of the Named Executive Officers are eligible for the additional employer contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants may direct their contributions and related company contributions to any investment option available under the Savings Plan, other than the investment options available under the self-directed account feature of the Savings Plan, subject to the trading restriction on Section 16 insiders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this trading restriction, participants designated as Section 16 insiders are restricted from transactions involving DTE Energy stock except during the four open window periods that occur each year after corporate earnings are announced.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Investment directions and exchanges may be made on a daily basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants are 100% vested at all times in the value of their contributions, Company matching contributions and additional employer contributions in the Supplemental Savings Plan.

sentences.text: We maintain bookkeeping accounts for participants in the Supplemental Savings Plan.
